# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " $word"
    end

    # Add the last line that hasn't been added yet
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nisi lectus, mollis nec elementum ac, eleifend at massa."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit
amet, consectetur adipiscing
elit. Sed nisi lectus, molli
sc nec elementum ac, eleifend
at massa.
```
